info.description: The API for the repositories of the content sources that you can use to create and manage repositories between third-party applications and the [Red Hat Hybrid Cloud Console](https://console.redhat.com). With these repositories, you can build and deploy images using Image Builder for Cloud, on-Premise, and Edge. You can handle tasks, search for required RPMs, fetch a GPGKey from the URL, and list the features within applications.
info.title: ContentSourcesBackend

post.description: This enables users to search for environments in a given list of repositories.

get.description: Get features enables retrieving information about the features within an application, regardless of their current status (enabled or disabled) and the user's access to them.
get.summary: List Features within the application, whether they are enabled, and whether the requesting user can use them

post.description: This enables users to search for package groups in a given list of repositories.

get.description: This operation enables retrieving a paginated list of repository suggestions that are commonly used.

parameters.description: Starting point for retrieving a subset of results. Determines how many items to skip from the beginning of the result set. Default value:`0`.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Number of items to include in response. Use it to control the number of items, particularly when dealing with large datasets. Default value: `100`.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Term to filter and retrieve items that match the specified search criteria. Search term can include name or URL.
parameters.name: search

get.description:
Get public repositories.
This enables listing a set of pre-created entries that represent a base set of RPMs needed for image building. These repositories are defined and made available to all user accounts, enabling them to perform RPM name searches using URLs as search criteria. These public repositories are not listed by the normal repositories API.
It does not show up via the normal repositories API.

parameters.description: Starting point for retrieving a subset of results. Determines how many items to skip from the beginning of the result set. Default value:`0`.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Number of items to include in response. Use it to control the number of items, particularly when dealing with large datasets. Default value: `100`.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: A comma separated list of release versions to filter on. For example, `1,2` would return repositories with versions 1 or 2 only.
parameters.name: version

parameters.description: A comma separated list of architectures or platforms for that you want to retrieve repositories. It controls responses where repositories support multiple architectures or platforms. For example, x86_64,s390x' returns repositories with `x86_64` or `s390x` only.
parameters.name: arch

parameters.description: Filter repositories by supported release version. For example, `1` returns repositories with the version `1` or where version is not set.
parameters.name: available_for_version

parameters.description: Filter repositories by architecture. For example, `x86_64` returns repositories with the version `x86_64` or where architecture is not set.
parameters.name: available_for_arch

parameters.description: Term to filter and retrieve items that match the specified search criteria. Search term can include name or URL.
parameters.name: search

parameters.name: uuid

parameters.name: sort_by

parameters.description: A comma separated list of statuses to control api response. Statuses can include `pending`, `valid`, `invalid`, `unavailable`.
parameters.name: status

parameters.description: A comma separated list of origins to filter api response. Origins can include `red_hat` and `external`.
parameters.name: origin

parameters.description: content type of a repository to filter on (rpm)
parameters.name: content_type

This validates the parameters before creating a repository. It provides a way to ensure the accuracy and validity of the provided parameters, including a check for the presence of remote yum metadata. Users can perform necessary checks before proceeding with the creation of a repository.
post.summary: Validate parameters prior to creating a repository
